Package com.android

Class Human

java.lang.Object
com.android.Human
public class Human
extends Object
This class is used in conjunction wiht Examples.ex1() this class is used to show lazy instantiation of a Stream of objects, which will we then use to create a Set of those same objects. The variable myShoes will be a Stream of shoes, and will be used to create a Set of shoes for every Human, called shoeSet. Inside an initialisation block we create a Stream and do some intermediate operations on the Stream, but no terminal operations occur at this point, so nothing is produced at this point. Its only when a Human class calls the makeShoes() method that a terminal operation is called on the stream, and it's only at this point is a stream of shoes is produced. The Terminal operation collect() creates a set of shoes from the stream of shoes and assigns them to the shoeSet varibable
Author:
NoelF
See Also:
Shoes, Examples.ex1()

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    (package private) int age
    age of the Human
    (package private) Stream<Shoes> myShoes

    (package private) String name
    name of the Human
    (package private) int shoeAmt
    amount of pairs of shoes a Human has, will be used with the intermediate operation limit() to tell our Stream how many pairs of shoes needs to be created
    (package private) Set<Shoes> shoeSet
    our collection of pairs of shoes which will be created from the Stream myShoes

  • Constructor Details

    • Human

      Human​(int age, String name, int shoeAmt)
      a constrcutor that takes a int age, String name and a int shoeAmt
      Parameters:
      age - is the age of the Human
      name - is the name of the Huan
      shoeAmt - is the amount of pairs of shoes the Human will have, and the stream myShoes will use the intermediate operation limit() in the makeShoes() to determine how many pairs of shoes will be created for this HUman

  • Method Details

    • makeShoes

      void makeShoes()
      the Stream myShoes and its initialisation does NOT have a terminal operation, so no result will be seen until a terminal operation is performed on this Stream. This method calls the collect() Terminal operation on the Stream, which causes all the operations to happen to the stream and it is only at this point that all operations are seen to run. What we have is Stream.generate(()->new Shoes((int)(Math.random()*10+1),Colour.BLACK)).//creates a stream of shoes, all black with sizes 1 to 10 filter((s)->s.size>6).//filters to shoes with a size greater than 6 filter(s->s.size<9).//filters to shoes with a size less than 9 limit(shoeAmt).//this is from makeShoes() method and this is the amount of pairs of shoes a Human will have, shoeAmt is provided by the constructor collect(Collectors.toSet());//saves our Stream to a set of Shoes, which is a Terminal operation and causes all of other operations to be performed this is lazy instantiation, our shoes are NOT created until we call the terminal operation in this method.
      See Also:
      Shoes
